Posts.Content: Hi JAW, Welcome to the forums. I do not know anything about breast cancer, although one of my aunts had breast cancer. I did find a link from the American Cancer Society which might shed a little light on the subject. I hope this helps and I will say a pray for you this morning for successful treatments. http://www.cancer.org/docroot/NWS/co..._Returning.asp
Posts.Signature: rmaureen Diagnosed Sept. 2005 Stage III-C Endometrial Adenocarcinoma Grade 2 My Story: http://fierytrial.wordpress.com/2009/12/09/my-diagnosis
Posts.Title: Breast Radiation & Heart

Posts.Content: Hi BlueStar, What a tough time for you and your mom! She will be in my prayers. Tell her to hang in there and fight with her all, and to rely on the Lord during this difficult time. He has been my anchor, and my strength. I will be believing for her fast recovery, and for successful treatment! Rhonda
Posts.Signature: rmaureen Diagnosed Sept. 2005 Stage III-C Endometrial Adenocarcinoma Grade 2 My Story: http://fierytrial.wordpress.com/2009/12/09/my-diagnosis
Posts.Title: Test of Faith again!

Posts.Content: Hi ladybug01: I am sorry to hear about your aunt. I felt a need to do some heavy editing on my original post, because I got confused on the origin of your aunt's cancer . I hope I didn't confuse you with my lack of knowledge on the subject (I do not know if you already read my original post). Sorry--she is dealing with metastasized breast cancer as Jim mentions below. I will continue to keep her in my prayers.
Posts.Signature: rmaureen Diagnosed Sept. 2005 Stage III-C Endometrial Adenocarcinoma Grade 2 My Story: http://fierytrial.wordpress.com/2009/12/09/my-diagnosis
Posts.Title: Bad signs??

Posts.Content: Hi mintjulip, I am sorry about what is happening to your mother and and I know this must be a very trying time for you. It can be a real struggle in making a decision on such a dilemma like you were faced with; but I think its good to be with your mother during this time. There is certainly no easy to answer to these things. I lost my aunt to breast cancer, it was diagnosed about five months after she had a mammogram. My heart really goes out to you, and you and your mom are in my thoughts and prayers.
Posts.Signature: rmaureen Diagnosed Sept. 2005 Stage III-C Endometrial Adenocarcinoma Grade 2 My Story: http://fierytrial.wordpress.com/2009/12/09/my-diagnosis
Posts.Title: Mom has metastases in bones and liver, not much time left

Posts.Content: Hi Nancy, I do not know much about breast cancer, but I know Stage 2 can be very curable depending on the type of breast cancer. I know of a lady who was diagnosed with Stage 4 going on years after her diagnosis. I am sure you and your mom know more now when you first wrote here. My prayers are with you both this morning.
Posts.Signature: rmaureen Diagnosed Sept. 2005 Stage III-C Endometrial Adenocarcinoma Grade 2 My Story: http://fierytrial.wordpress.com/2009/12/09/my-diagnosis
Posts.Title: Mother diagnosed with breast cancer
